an4.170:1.2: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
an4.170:2.1: “Reverends, all of the monks and nuns who declare in my presence that they have attained perfection, did so by one or other of four paths.
an4.170:3.2: Take a mendicant who develops serenity before discernment.
an4.170:3.3: As they do so, the path is born in them.
an4.170:3.4: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.
an4.170:3.5: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.
an4.170:4.1: Another mendicant develops discernment before serenity.
an4.170:4.2: As they do so, the path is born in them.
an4.170:4.3: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.
an4.170:4.4: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.
an4.170:5.1: Another mendicant develops serenity and discernment in conjunction.
an4.170:5.2: As they do so, the path is born in them.
an4.170:5.3: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.
an4.170:5.4: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.
an4.170:6.1: Another mendicant’s heart is seized by restlessness to realize the teaching.
an4.170:6.2: But there comes a time when their mind is stilled internally; it settles, unifies, and becomes immersed in samādhi.
an4.170:6.3: The path is born in them.
an4.170:6.4: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.
an4.170:6.5: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.
an4.170:7.1: All of the monks and nuns who declare in my presence that they have attained perfection, did so by one or other of these four paths.”
